intro: Tricalysia bridsoniana var. pandensis, commonly known as the Bridson's pande tree, is a rare and striking tropical plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It is characterized by its large, elongated leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length, often with a velvety texture and a deep green coloration. The plant produces striking, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow, which bloom in clusters along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species and is often cultivated in botanical gardens for conservation purposes.
